ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function

Interface Function

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Connectable, Contextualizable, Duplicable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsoluteValue, Addition, And, AtomicFunction, BooleanConnective, Circuit, Constant, ElementAt, Equals, Eventually, Filter, Fork, GetSize, Globally, IfThenElse, InstanceOf, IsGreaterThan, Multiplication, Next, Not, NumberCast, Or, ParameterizedVectorFunction, Split, Subtraction, Triangle.AllNumbers, Triangle.AllPositive, Triangle.IsPositive, Triangle.IsValidTriangle, Triangle.TriangleInequality, UnaryOperator, VectorAnd, VectorApply, VectorBooleanConnective, VectorFunction, VectorOr, VectorOutputFunction, VectorProduct, VectorSum, Window

    public interface Function
extends Connectable, Contextualizable, Duplicable
    An object that receives inputs and produces outputs. To this end, a function must implement a method called evaluate().
    Author:
    Sylvain Hallé

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object[] evaluate(java.lang.Object... inputs)
      Evaluates a function on input arguments.
      void reset()
      Resets the state of the function to that of a fresh instance of the class.

      • Methods inherited from interface ca.uqac.lif.dag.Connectable

        addToInput, addToOutput, getInputArity, getInputLinks, getInputPin, getOutputArity, getOutputLinks, getOutputPin, removeFromInput, removeFromOutput, setToInput, setToOutput

      • Methods inherited from interface ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function.Contextualizable

        getContext, setContext

      • Methods inherited from interface ca.uqac.lif.util.Duplicable

        duplicate, duplicate

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        java.lang.Object[] evaluate(java.lang.Object... inputs)
        Evaluates a function on input arguments.
        Parameters:
        inputs - The input arguments. The number of arguments must be equal to the function's input arity.
        Returns:
        An array containing the output values produced by the function. The size of this array must be equal to the function's output arity.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the state of the function to that of a fresh instance of the class.
